VersionOne IntelliJ IDEA Plugin User Guide
Description
The VersionOne IjtelliJ Idea Plugin (V1IntelliJPlugIn) provides direct interaction with development task in VersionOne from within the IntelliJ IDEA IDE. This enables Java developers to update VersionOne task status, estimates, remaining effort, etc., without leaving the confines of the Eclipse environment.
System Requirements
VersionOne: 7.3 or above
Client Workstation:
IDE—Tested with IntelliJ IDEA 8.0
&downloads;
Installation
&name; can be installed manually or from the IntelliJ Plugin Repository.
1a. Manual Install
To manually install &name;
Unzip the &name;.zip file into a temporary location. We will refer to this location as INSTALL_TEMP
Locate the IntelliJ installation directory. We will refer to this location as INTELLIJ_DIR
Copy the VersionOne subdirectory from INSTALL_TEMP to the plugin directory located under INTELLIJ_DIR

2. Configure the Plugin
Select Settings from the File menu (File | Settings), and navigate to the VersionOne settings as show in .
Configuration Options Screen
Enter the configuration parameters as specified in the table below and click Validate Connection to ensure that the add-in can both access VersionOne’s API and authenticate using the supplied username and password.
VSAddin Configuration Parameters
Parameter Description
Windows Integrated Authentication Check this box if your VersionOne instance uses Windows Integraten Authentication.
Application URL VersionOne installation URL
Username User that will access VersionOne.
Password Password for the username above.
Usage
&name; contributes two new components to the IntelliJ IDEA environment; a Task Window and a Detail Window. The Task Window is available in the tool button bar located at the bottom of the UI.
Tasks Window
The Details Window is available in the tool button bar located on the right hand side of the UI
Details Window
Selecting Projects
In order to view VersionOne Task you must first select a Project. To select a Project click the Filter icon located on the left side of the Task Window.
Projects Window
To choose a specific project to work on, simply navigate the tree and select it. Once selected, click OK to exit.
The Filter dialog also supports a "Show All Tasks" checkbox. Use this option to view all task in the active iteration. When this checkbox is clear you only see task assigned to the configured user in the active iteration
Updating Tasks
Once the filter is closed the Task Window will refresh and list all VersionOne Task based on the filter. To update a task, modify the attribute directly in the grid. Once you’re finished updating a Task, click the Save icon to commit your changes to VersionOne.
